3732// Internally used only
3733impl Command {
3734    pub(crate) fn get_override_usage(&self) -> Option<&StyledStr> {
3735        self.usage_str.as_ref()
3736    }
3737
3738    pub(crate) fn get_override_help(&self) -> Option<&StyledStr> {
3739        self.help_str.as_ref()
3740    }
3741
3742    #[cfg(feature = "help")]
3743    pub(crate) fn get_help_template(&self) -> Option<&StyledStr> {
3744        self.template.as_ref()
3745    }
3746
3747    #[cfg(feature = "help")]
3748    pub(crate) fn get_term_width(&self) -> Option<usize> {
3749        self.term_w
3750    }
3751
3752    #[cfg(feature = "help")]
3753    pub(crate) fn get_max_term_width(&self) -> Option<usize> {
3754        self.max_w
3755    }
3756
3757    pub(crate) fn get_replacement(&self, key: &str) -> Option<&[Str]> {
3758        self.replacers.get(key).map(|v| v.as_slice())
3759    }
3760
3761    pub(crate) fn get_keymap(&self) -> &MKeyMap {
3762        &self.args
3763    }
3764
3765    fn get_used_global_args(&self, matches: &ArgMatches, global_arg_vec: &mut Vec<Id>) {
3766        global_arg_vec.extend(
3767            self.args
3768                .args()
3769                .filter(|a| a.is_global_set())
3770                .map(|ga| ga.id.clone()),
3771        );
3772        if let Some((id, matches)) = matches.subcommand() {
3773            if let Some(used_sub) = self.find_subcommand(id) {
3774                used_sub.get_used_global_args(matches, global_arg_vec);
3775            }
3776        }
3777    }
3778
3779    fn _do_parse(
3780        &mut self,
3781        raw_args: &mut clap_lex::RawArgs,
3782        args_cursor: clap_lex::ArgCursor,
3783    ) -> ClapResult<ArgMatches> {
3784        debug!("Command::_do_parse");
3785
3786        // If there are global arguments, or settings we need to propagate them down to subcommands
3787        // before parsing in case we run into a subcommand
3788        self._build_self(false);
3789
3790        let mut matcher = ArgMatcher::new(self);
3791
3792        // do the real parsing
3793        let mut parser = Parser::new(self);
3794        if let Err(error) = parser.get_matches_with(&mut matcher, raw_args, args_cursor) {
3795            if self.is_set(AppSettings::IgnoreErrors) {
3796                debug!("Command::_do_parse: ignoring error: {}", error);
3797            } else {
3798                return Err(error);
3799            }
3800        }
3801
3802        let mut global_arg_vec = Default::default();
3803        self.get_used_global_args(&matcher, &mut global_arg_vec);
3804
3805        matcher.propagate_globals(&global_arg_vec);
3806
3807        Ok(matcher.into_inner())
3808    }
3809
3810    /// Prepare for introspecting on all included [`Command`]s
3811    ///
3812    /// Call this on the top-level [`Command`] when done building and before reading state for
3813    /// cases like completions, custom help output, etc.
3814    pub fn build(&mut self) {
3815        self._build_recursive(true);
3816        self._build_bin_names_internal();
3817    }
3818
3819    pub(crate) fn _build_recursive(&mut self, expand_help_tree: bool) {
3820        self._build_self(expand_help_tree);
3821        for subcmd in self.get_subcommands_mut() {
3822            subcmd._build_recursive(expand_help_tree);
3823        }
3824    }
3825
3826    pub(crate) fn _build_self(&mut self, expand_help_tree: bool) {
3827        debug!("Command::_build: name={:?}", self.get_name());
3828        if !self.settings.is_set(AppSettings::Built) {
3829            // Make sure all the globally set flags apply to us as well
3830            self.settings = self.settings | self.g_settings;
3831
3832            if self.is_multicall_set() {
3833                self.settings.insert(AppSettings::SubcommandRequired.into());
3834                self.settings.insert(AppSettings::DisableHelpFlag.into());
3835                self.settings.insert(AppSettings::DisableVersionFlag.into());
3836            }
3837            if !cfg!(feature = "help") && self.get_override_help().is_none() {
3838                self.settings.insert(AppSettings::DisableHelpFlag.into());
3839                self.settings
3840                    .insert(AppSettings::DisableHelpSubcommand.into());
3841            }
3842            if self.is_set(AppSettings::ArgsNegateSubcommands) {
3843                self.settings
3844                    .insert(AppSettings::SubcommandsNegateReqs.into());
3845            }
3846            if self.external_value_parser.is_some() {
3847                self.settings
3848                    .insert(AppSettings::AllowExternalSubcommands.into());
3849            }
3850            if !self.has_subcommands() {
3851                self.settings
3852                    .insert(AppSettings::DisableHelpSubcommand.into());
3853            }
3854
3855            self._propagate();
3856            self._check_help_and_version(expand_help_tree);
3857            self._propagate_global_args();
3858
3859            let mut pos_counter = 1;
3860            let hide_pv = self.is_set(AppSettings::HidePossibleValues);
3861            for a in self.args.args_mut() {
3862                // Fill in the groups
3863                for g in &a.groups {
3864                    if let Some(ag) = self.groups.iter_mut().find(|grp| grp.id == *g) {
3865                        ag.args.push(a.get_id().clone());
3866                    } else {
3867                        let mut ag = ArgGroup::new(g);
3868                        ag.args.push(a.get_id().clone());
3869                        self.groups.push(ag);
3870                    }
3871                }
3872
3873                // Figure out implied settings
3874                a._build();
3875                if hide_pv && a.is_takes_value_set() {
3876                    a.settings.set(ArgSettings::HidePossibleValues);
3877                }
3878                if a.is_positional() && a.index.is_none() {
3879                    a.index = Some(pos_counter);
3880                    pos_counter += 1;
3881                }
3882            }
3883
3884            self.args._build();
3885
3886            #[allow(deprecated)]
3887            {
3888                let highest_idx = self
3889                    .get_keymap()
3890                    .keys()
3891                    .filter_map(|x| {
3892                        if let crate::mkeymap::KeyType::Position(n) = x {
3893                            Some(*n)
3894                        } else {
3895                            None
3896                        }
3897                    })
3898                    .max()
3899                    .unwrap_or(0);
3900                let is_trailing_var_arg_set = self.is_trailing_var_arg_set();
3901                let is_allow_hyphen_values_set = self.is_allow_hyphen_values_set();
3902                let is_allow_negative_numbers_set = self.is_allow_negative_numbers_set();
3903                for arg in self.args.args_mut() {
3904                    if is_allow_hyphen_values_set && arg.is_takes_value_set() {
3905                        arg.settings.insert(ArgSettings::AllowHyphenValues.into());
3906                    }
3907                    if is_allow_negative_numbers_set && arg.is_takes_value_set() {
3908                        arg.settings
3909                            .insert(ArgSettings::AllowNegativeNumbers.into());
3910                    }
3911                    if is_trailing_var_arg_set && arg.get_index() == Some(highest_idx) {
3912                        arg.settings.insert(ArgSettings::TrailingVarArg.into());
3913                    }
3914                }
3915            }
3916
3917            #[cfg(debug_assertions)]
3918            assert_app(self);
3919            self.settings.set(AppSettings::Built);
3920        } else {
3921            debug!("Command::_build: already built");
3922        }
3923    }
3924
3925    pub(crate) fn _build_subcommand(&mut self, name: &str) -> Option<&mut Self> {
3926        use std::fmt::Write;
3927
3928        let mut mid_string = String::from(" ");
3929        #[cfg(feature = "usage")]
3930        if !self.is_subcommand_negates_reqs_set() && !self.is_args_conflicts_with_subcommands_set()
3931        {
3932            let reqs = Usage::new(self).get_required_usage_from(&[], None, true); // maybe Some(m)
3933
3934            for s in &reqs {
3935                mid_string.push_str(&s.to_string());
3936                mid_string.push(' ');
3937            }
3938        }
3939        let is_multicall_set = self.is_multicall_set();
3940
3941        let sc = some!(self.subcommands.iter_mut().find(|s| s.name == name));
3942
3943        // Display subcommand name, short and long in usage
3944        let mut sc_names = String::new();
3945        sc_names.push_str(sc.name.as_str());
3946        let mut flag_subcmd = false;
3947        if let Some(l) = sc.get_long_flag() {
3948            write!(sc_names, "|--{}", l).unwrap();
3949            flag_subcmd = true;
3950        }
3951        if let Some(s) = sc.get_short_flag() {
3952            write!(sc_names, "|-{}", s).unwrap();
3953            flag_subcmd = true;
3954        }
3955
3956        if flag_subcmd {
3957            sc_names = format!("{{{}}}", sc_names);
3958        }
3959
3960        let usage_name = self
3961            .bin_name
3962            .as_ref()
3963            .map(|bin_name| format!("{}{}{}", bin_name, mid_string, sc_names))
3964            .unwrap_or(sc_names);
3965        sc.usage_name = Some(usage_name);
3966
3967        // bin_name should be parent's bin_name + [<reqs>] + the sc's name separated by
3968        // a space
3969        let bin_name = format!(
3970            "{}{}{}",
3971            self.bin_name.as_deref().unwrap_or_default(),
3972            if self.bin_name.is_some() { " " } else { "" },
3973            &*sc.name
3974        );
3975        debug!(
3976            "Command::_build_subcommand Setting bin_name of {} to {:?}",
3977            sc.name, bin_name
3978        );
3979        sc.bin_name = Some(bin_name);
3980
3981        if sc.display_name.is_none() {
3982            let self_display_name = if is_multicall_set {
3983                self.display_name.as_deref().unwrap_or("")
3984            } else {
3985                self.display_name.as_deref().unwrap_or(&self.name)
3986            };
3987            let display_name = format!(
3988                "{}{}{}",
3989                self_display_name,
3990                if !self_display_name.is_empty() {
3991                    "-"
3992                } else {
3993                    ""
3994                },
3995                &*sc.name
3996            );
3997            debug!(
3998                "Command::_build_subcommand Setting display_name of {} to {:?}",
3999                sc.name, display_name
4000            );
4001            sc.display_name = Some(display_name);
4002        }
4003
4004        // Ensure all args are built and ready to parse
4005        sc._build_self(false);
4006
4007        Some(sc)
4008    }
4009
4010    fn _build_bin_names_internal(&mut self) {
4011        debug!("Command::_build_bin_names");
4012
4013        if !self.is_set(AppSettings::BinNameBuilt) {
4014            let mut mid_string = String::from(" ");
4015            #[cfg(feature = "usage")]
4016            if !self.is_subcommand_negates_reqs_set()
4017                && !self.is_args_conflicts_with_subcommands_set()
4018            {
4019                let reqs = Usage::new(self).get_required_usage_from(&[], None, true); // maybe Some(m)
4020
4021                for s in &reqs {
4022                    mid_string.push_str(&s.to_string());
4023                    mid_string.push(' ');
4024                }
4025            }
4026            let is_multicall_set = self.is_multicall_set();
4027
4028            let self_bin_name = if is_multicall_set {
4029                self.bin_name.as_deref().unwrap_or("")
4030            } else {
4031                self.bin_name.as_deref().unwrap_or(&self.name)
4032            }
4033            .to_owned();
4034
4035            for mut sc in &mut self.subcommands {
4036                debug!("Command::_build_bin_names:iter: bin_name set...");
4037
4038                if sc.usage_name.is_none() {
4039                    use std::fmt::Write;
4040                    // Display subcommand name, short and long in usage
4041                    let mut sc_names = String::new();
4042                    sc_names.push_str(sc.name.as_str());
4043                    let mut flag_subcmd = false;
4044                    if let Some(l) = sc.get_long_flag() {
4045                        write!(sc_names, "|--{}", l).unwrap();
4046                        flag_subcmd = true;
4047                    }
4048                    if let Some(s) = sc.get_short_flag() {
4049                        write!(sc_names, "|-{}", s).unwrap();
4050                        flag_subcmd = true;
4051                    }
4052
4053                    if flag_subcmd {
4054                        sc_names = format!("{{{}}}", sc_names);
4055                    }
4056
4057                    let usage_name = format!("{}{}{}", self_bin_name, mid_string, sc_names);
4058                    debug!(
4059                        "Command::_build_bin_names:iter: Setting usage_name of {} to {:?}",
4060                        sc.name, usage_name
4061                    );
4062                    sc.usage_name = Some(usage_name);
4063                } else {
4064                    debug!(
4065                        "Command::_build_bin_names::iter: Using existing usage_name of {} ({:?})",
4066                        sc.name, sc.usage_name
4067                    );
4068                }
4069
4070                if sc.bin_name.is_none() {
4071                    let bin_name = format!(
4072                        "{}{}{}",
4073                        self_bin_name,
4074                        if !self_bin_name.is_empty() { " " } else { "" },
4075                        &*sc.name
4076                    );
4077                    debug!(
4078                        "Command::_build_bin_names:iter: Setting bin_name of {} to {:?}",
4079                        sc.name, bin_name
4080                    );
4081                    sc.bin_name = Some(bin_name);
4082                } else {
4083                    debug!(
4084                        "Command::_build_bin_names::iter: Using existing bin_name of {} ({:?})",
4085                        sc.name, sc.bin_name
4086                    );
4087                }
4088
4089                if sc.display_name.is_none() {
4090                    let self_display_name = if is_multicall_set {
4091                        self.display_name.as_deref().unwrap_or("")
4092                    } else {
4093                        self.display_name.as_deref().unwrap_or(&self.name)
4094                    };
4095                    let display_name = format!(
4096                        "{}{}{}",
4097                        self_display_name,
4098                        if !self_display_name.is_empty() {
4099                            "-"
4100                        } else {
4101                            ""
4102                        },
4103                        &*sc.name
4104                    );
4105                    debug!(
4106                        "Command::_build_bin_names:iter: Setting display_name of {} to {:?}",
4107                        sc.name, display_name
4108                    );
4109                    sc.display_name = Some(display_name);
4110                } else {
4111                    debug!(
4112                        "Command::_build_bin_names::iter: Using existing display_name of {} ({:?})",
4113                        sc.name, sc.display_name
4114                    );
4115                }
4116
4117                sc._build_bin_names_internal();
4118            }
4119            self.set(AppSettings::BinNameBuilt);
4120        } else {
4121            debug!("Command::_build_bin_names: already built");
4122        }
4123    }
4124
4125    pub(crate) fn _panic_on_missing_help(&self, help_required_globally: bool) {
4126        if self.is_set(AppSettings::HelpExpected) || help_required_globally {
4127            let args_missing_help: Vec<Id> = self
4128                .args
4129                .args()
4130                .filter(|arg| arg.get_help().is_none() && arg.get_long_help().is_none())
4131                .map(|arg| arg.get_id().clone())
4132                .collect();
4133
4134            debug_assert!(args_missing_help.is_empty(),
4135                    "Command::help_expected is enabled for the Command {}, but at least one of its arguments does not have either `help` or `long_help` set. List of such arguments: {}",
4136                    self.name,
4137                    args_missing_help.join(", ")
4138                );
4139        }
4140
4141        for sub_app in &self.subcommands {
4142            sub_app._panic_on_missing_help(help_required_globally);
4143        }
4144    }
4145
4146    #[cfg(debug_assertions)]
4147    pub(crate) fn two_args_of<F>(&self, condition: F) -> Option<(&Arg, &Arg)>
4148    where
4149        F: Fn(&Arg) -> bool,
4150    {
4151        two_elements_of(self.args.args().filter(|a: &&Arg| condition(a)))
4152    }
4153
4154    // just in case
4155    #[allow(unused)]
4156    fn two_groups_of<F>(&self, condition: F) -> Option<(&ArgGroup, &ArgGroup)>
4157    where
4158        F: Fn(&ArgGroup) -> bool,
4159    {
4160        two_elements_of(self.groups.iter().filter(|a| condition(a)))
4161    }
4162
4163    /// Propagate global args
4164    pub(crate) fn _propagate_global_args(&mut self) {
4165        debug!("Command::_propagate_global_args:{}", self.name);
4166
4167        let autogenerated_help_subcommand = !self.is_disable_help_subcommand_set();
4168
4169        for sc in &mut self.subcommands {
4170            if sc.get_name() == "help" && autogenerated_help_subcommand {
4171                // Avoid propagating args to the autogenerated help subtrees used in completion.
4172                // This prevents args from showing up during help completions like
4173                // `myapp help subcmd <TAB>`, which should only suggest subcommands and not args,
4174                // while still allowing args to show up properly on the generated help message.
4175                continue;
4176            }
4177
4178            for a in self.args.args().filter(|a| a.is_global_set()) {
4179                if sc.find(&a.id).is_some() {
4180                    debug!(
4181                        "Command::_propagate skipping {:?} to {}, already exists",
4182                        a.id,
4183                        sc.get_name(),
4184                    );
4185                    continue;
4186                }
4187
4188                debug!(
4189                    "Command::_propagate pushing {:?} to {}",
4190                    a.id,
4191                    sc.get_name(),
4192                );
4193                sc.args.push(a.clone());
4194            }
4195        }
4196    }
4197
4198    /// Propagate settings
4199    pub(crate) fn _propagate(&mut self) {
4200        debug!("Command::_propagate:{}", self.name);
4201        let mut subcommands = std::mem::take(&mut self.subcommands);
4202        for sc in &mut subcommands {
4203            self._propagate_subcommand(sc);
4204        }
4205        self.subcommands = subcommands;
4206    }
4207
4208    fn _propagate_subcommand(&self, sc: &mut Self) {
4209        // We have to create a new scope in order to tell rustc the borrow of `sc` is
4210        // done and to recursively call this method
4211        {
4212            if self.settings.is_set(AppSettings::PropagateVersion) {
4213                if let Some(version) = self.version.as_ref() {
4214                    sc.version.get_or_insert_with(|| version.clone());
4215                }
4216                if let Some(long_version) = self.long_version.as_ref() {
4217                    sc.long_version.get_or_insert_with(|| long_version.clone());
4218                }
4219            }
4220
4221            sc.settings = sc.settings | self.g_settings;
4222            sc.g_settings = sc.g_settings | self.g_settings;
4223            sc.term_w = self.term_w;
4224            sc.max_w = self.max_w;
4225        }
4226    }
4227
4228    pub(crate) fn _check_help_and_version(&mut self, expand_help_tree: bool) {
4229        debug!(
4230            "Command::_check_help_and_version:{} expand_help_tree={}",
4231            self.name, expand_help_tree
4232        );
4233
4234        self.long_help_exists = self.long_help_exists_();
4235
4236        if !self.is_disable_help_flag_set() {
4237            debug!("Command::_check_help_and_version: Building default --help");
4238            let mut arg = Arg::new(Id::HELP)
4239                .short('h')
4240                .long("help")
4241                .action(ArgAction::Help);
4242            if self.long_help_exists {
4243                arg = arg
4244                    .help("Print help information (use `--help` for more detail)")
4245                    .long_help("Print help information (use `-h` for a summary)");
4246            } else {
4247                arg = arg.help("Print help information");
4248            }
4249            // Avoiding `arg_internal` to not be sensitive to `next_help_heading` /
4250            // `next_display_order`
4251            self.args.push(arg);
4252        }
4253        if !self.is_disable_version_flag_set() {
4254            debug!("Command::_check_help_and_version: Building default --version");
4255            let arg = Arg::new(Id::VERSION)
4256                .short('V')
4257                .long("version")
4258                .action(ArgAction::Version)
4259                .help("Print version information");
4260            // Avoiding `arg_internal` to not be sensitive to `next_help_heading` /
4261            // `next_display_order`
4262            self.args.push(arg);
4263        }
4264
4265        if !self.is_set(AppSettings::DisableHelpSubcommand) {
4266            debug!("Command::_check_help_and_version: Building help subcommand");
4267            let help_about = "Print this message or the help of the given subcommand(s)";
4268
4269            let mut help_subcmd = if expand_help_tree {
4270                // Slow code path to recursively clone all other subcommand subtrees under help
4271                let help_subcmd = Command::new("help")
4272                    .about(help_about)
4273                    .global_setting(AppSettings::DisableHelpSubcommand)
4274                    .subcommands(self.get_subcommands().map(Command::_copy_subtree_for_help));
4275
4276                let mut help_help_subcmd = Command::new("help").about(help_about);
4277                help_help_subcmd.version = None;
4278                help_help_subcmd.long_version = None;
4279                help_help_subcmd = help_help_subcmd
4280                    .setting(AppSettings::DisableHelpFlag)
4281                    .setting(AppSettings::DisableVersionFlag);
4282
4283                help_subcmd.subcommand(help_help_subcmd)
4284            } else {
4285                Command::new("help").about(help_about).arg(
4286                    Arg::new("subcommand")
4287                        .action(ArgAction::Append)
4288                        .num_args(..)
4289                        .value_name("COMMAND")
4290                        .help("The subcommand whose help message to display"),
4291                )
4292            };
4293            self._propagate_subcommand(&mut help_subcmd);
4294
4295            // The parser acts like this is set, so let's set it so we don't falsely
4296            // advertise it to the user
4297            help_subcmd.version = None;
4298            help_subcmd.long_version = None;
4299            help_subcmd = help_subcmd
4300                .setting(AppSettings::DisableHelpFlag)
4301                .setting(AppSettings::DisableVersionFlag)
4302                .unset_global_setting(AppSettings::PropagateVersion);
4303
4304            self.subcommands.push(help_subcmd);
4305        }
4306    }
4307
4308    fn _copy_subtree_for_help(&self) -> Command {
4309        let mut cmd = Command::new(self.name.clone())
4310            .hide(self.is_hide_set())
4311            .global_setting(AppSettings::DisableHelpFlag)
4312            .global_setting(AppSettings::DisableVersionFlag)
4313            .subcommands(self.get_subcommands().map(Command::_copy_subtree_for_help));
4314        if self.get_about().is_some() {
4315            cmd = cmd.about(self.get_about().unwrap().clone());
4316        }
4317        cmd
4318    }
4319
4320    pub(crate) fn _render_version(&self, use_long: bool) -> String {
4321        debug!("Command::_render_version");
4322
4323        let ver = if use_long {
4324            self.long_version
4325                .as_deref()
4326                .or(self.version.as_deref())
4327                .unwrap_or_default()
4328        } else {
4329            self.version
4330                .as_deref()
4331                .or(self.long_version.as_deref())
4332                .unwrap_or_default()
4333        };
4334        let display_name = self.get_display_name().unwrap_or_else(|| self.get_name());
4335        format!("{} {}\n", display_name, ver)
4336    }
4337
4338    pub(crate) fn format_group(&self, g: &Id) -> StyledStr {
4339        let g_string = self
4340            .unroll_args_in_group(g)
4341            .iter()
4342            .filter_map(|x| self.find(x))
4343            .map(|x| {
4344                if x.is_positional() {
4345                    // Print val_name for positional arguments. e.g. <file_name>
4346                    x.name_no_brackets()
4347                } else {
4348                    // Print usage string for flags arguments, e.g. <--help>
4349                    x.to_string()
4350                }
4351            })
4352            .collect::<Vec<_>>()
4353            .join("|");
4354        let mut styled = StyledStr::new();
4355        styled.none("<");
4356        styled.none(g_string);
4357        styled.none(">");
4358        styled
4359    }
4360}
4361
4362/// A workaround:
4363/// <https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/34511#issuecomment-373423999>
4364pub(crate) trait Captures<'a> {}
4365impl<'a, T> Captures<'a> for T {}
4366
4367// Internal Query Methods
4368impl Command {
4369    /// Iterate through the *flags* & *options* arguments.
4370    #[cfg(any(feature = "usage", feature = "help"))]
4371    pub(crate) fn get_non_positionals(&self) -> impl Iterator<Item = &Arg> {
4372        self.get_arguments().filter(|a| !a.is_positional())
4373    }
4374
4375    pub(crate) fn find(&self, arg_id: &Id) -> Option<&Arg> {
4376        self.args.args().find(|a| a.get_id() == arg_id)
4377    }
4378
4379    #[inline]
4380    pub(crate) fn contains_short(&self, s: char) -> bool {
4381        debug_assert!(
4382            self.is_set(AppSettings::Built),
4383            "If Command::_build hasn't been called, manually search through Arg shorts"
4384        );
4385
4386        self.args.contains(s)
4387    }
4388
4389    #[inline]
4390    pub(crate) fn set(&mut self, s: AppSettings) {
4391        self.settings.set(s)
4392    }
4393
4394    #[inline]
4395    pub(crate) fn has_positionals(&self) -> bool {
4396        self.get_positionals().next().is_some()
4397    }
4398
4399    #[cfg(any(feature = "usage", feature = "help"))]
4400    pub(crate) fn has_visible_subcommands(&self) -> bool {
4401        self.subcommands
4402            .iter()
4403            .any(|sc| sc.name != "help" && !sc.is_set(AppSettings::Hidden))
4404    }
4405
4406    /// Check if this subcommand can be referred to as `name`. In other words,
4407    /// check if `name` is the name of this subcommand or is one of its aliases.
4408    #[inline]
4409    pub(crate) fn aliases_to(&self, name: impl AsRef<std::ffi::OsStr>) -> bool {
4410        let name = name.as_ref();
4411        self.get_name() == name || self.get_all_aliases().any(|alias| alias == name)
4412    }
4413
4414    /// Check if this subcommand can be referred to as `name`. In other words,
4415    /// check if `name` is the name of this short flag subcommand or is one of its short flag aliases.
4416    #[inline]
4417    pub(crate) fn short_flag_aliases_to(&self, flag: char) -> bool {
4418        Some(flag) == self.short_flag
4419            || self.get_all_short_flag_aliases().any(|alias| flag == alias)
4420    }
4421
4422    /// Check if this subcommand can be referred to as `name`. In other words,
4423    /// check if `name` is the name of this long flag subcommand or is one of its long flag aliases.
4424    #[inline]
4425    pub(crate) fn long_flag_aliases_to(&self, flag: &str) -> bool {
4426        match self.long_flag.as_ref() {
4427            Some(long_flag) => {
4428                long_flag == flag || self.get_all_long_flag_aliases().any(|alias| alias == flag)
4429            }
4430            None => self.get_all_long_flag_aliases().any(|alias| alias == flag),
4431        }
4432    }
4433
4434    #[cfg(debug_assertions)]
4435    pub(crate) fn id_exists(&self, id: &Id) -> bool {
4436        self.args.args().any(|x| x.get_id() == id) || self.groups.iter().any(|x| x.id == *id)
4437    }
4438
4439    /// Iterate through the groups this arg is member of.
4440    pub(crate) fn groups_for_arg<'a>(&'a self, arg: &Id) -> impl Iterator<Item = Id> + 'a {
4441        debug!("Command::groups_for_arg: id={:?}", arg);
4442        let arg = arg.clone();
4443        self.groups
4444            .iter()
4445            .filter(move |grp| grp.args.iter().any(|a| a == &arg))
4446            .map(|grp| grp.id.clone())
4447    }
4448
4449    pub(crate) fn find_group(&self, group_id: &Id) -> Option<&ArgGroup> {
4450        self.groups.iter().find(|g| g.id == *group_id)
4451    }
4452
4453    /// Iterate through all the names of all subcommands (not recursively), including aliases.
4454    /// Used for suggestions.
4455    pub(crate) fn all_subcommand_names(&self) -> impl Iterator<Item = &str> + Captures {
4456        self.get_subcommands().flat_map(|sc| {
4457            let name = sc.get_name();
4458            let aliases = sc.get_all_aliases();
4459            std::iter::once(name).chain(aliases)
4460        })
4461    }
4462
4463    pub(crate) fn required_graph(&self) -> ChildGraph<Id> {
4464        let mut reqs = ChildGraph::with_capacity(5);
4465        for a in self.args.args().filter(|a| a.is_required_set()) {
4466            reqs.insert(a.get_id().clone());
4467        }
4468        for group in &self.groups {
4469            if group.required {
4470                let idx = reqs.insert(group.id.clone());
4471                for a in &group.requires {
4472                    reqs.insert_child(idx, a.clone());
4473                }
4474            }
4475        }
4476
4477        reqs
4478    }
4479
4480    pub(crate) fn unroll_args_in_group(&self, group: &Id) -> Vec<Id> {
4481        debug!("Command::unroll_args_in_group: group={:?}", group);
4482        let mut g_vec = vec![group];
4483        let mut args = vec![];
4484
4485        while let Some(g) = g_vec.pop() {
4486            for n in self
4487                .groups
4488                .iter()
4489                .find(|grp| grp.id == *g)
4490                .expect(INTERNAL_ERROR_MSG)
4491                .args
4492                .iter()
4493            {
4494                debug!("Command::unroll_args_in_group:iter: entity={:?}", n);
4495                if !args.contains(n) {
4496                    if self.find(n).is_some() {
4497                        debug!("Command::unroll_args_in_group:iter: this is an arg");
4498                        args.push(n.clone())
4499                    } else {
4500                        debug!("Command::unroll_args_in_group:iter: this is a group");
4501                        g_vec.push(n);
4502                    }
4503                }
4504            }
4505        }
4506
4507        args
4508    }
4509
4510    pub(crate) fn unroll_arg_requires<F>(&self, func: F, arg: &Id) -> Vec<Id>
4511    where
4512        F: Fn(&(ArgPredicate, Id)) -> Option<Id>,
4513    {
4514        let mut processed = vec![];
4515        let mut r_vec = vec![arg];
4516        let mut args = vec![];
4517
4518        while let Some(a) = r_vec.pop() {
4519            if processed.contains(&a) {
4520                continue;
4521            }
4522
4523            processed.push(a);
4524
4525            if let Some(arg) = self.find(a) {
4526                for r in arg.requires.iter().filter_map(&func) {
4527                    if let Some(req) = self.find(&r) {
4528                        if !req.requires.is_empty() {
4529                            r_vec.push(req.get_id())
4530                        }
4531                    }
4532                    args.push(r);
4533                }
4534            }
4535        }
4536
4537        args
4538    }
4539
4540    /// Find a flag subcommand name by short flag or an alias
4541    pub(crate) fn find_short_subcmd(&self, c: char) -> Option<&str> {
4542        self.get_subcommands()
4543            .find(|sc| sc.short_flag_aliases_to(c))
4544            .map(|sc| sc.get_name())
4545    }
4546
4547    /// Find a flag subcommand name by long flag or an alias
4548    pub(crate) fn find_long_subcmd(&self, long: &str) -> Option<&str> {
4549        self.get_subcommands()
4550            .find(|sc| sc.long_flag_aliases_to(long))
4551            .map(|sc| sc.get_name())
4552    }
4553
4554    #[cfg(feature = "help")]
4555    pub(crate) fn get_display_order(&self) -> usize {
4556        self.disp_ord.unwrap_or(999)
4557    }
4558
4559    pub(crate) fn write_help_err(&self, mut use_long: bool) -> StyledStr {
4560        debug!(
4561            "Command::write_help_err: {}, use_long={:?}",
4562            self.get_display_name().unwrap_or_else(|| self.get_name()),
4563            use_long && self.long_help_exists(),
4564        );
4565
4566        use_long = use_long && self.long_help_exists();
4567        let usage = Usage::new(self);
4568
4569        let mut styled = StyledStr::new();
4570        write_help(&mut styled, self, &usage, use_long);
4571
4572        styled
4573    }
4574
4575    pub(crate) fn write_version_err(&self, use_long: bool) -> StyledStr {
4576        let msg = self._render_version(use_long);
4577        let mut styled = StyledStr::new();
4578        styled.none(msg);
4579        styled
4580    }
4581
4582    pub(crate) fn long_help_exists(&self) -> bool {
4583        debug!("Command::long_help_exists: {}", self.long_help_exists);
4584        self.long_help_exists
4585    }
4586
4587    fn long_help_exists_(&self) -> bool {
4588        debug!("Command::long_help_exists");
4589        // In this case, both must be checked. This allows the retention of
4590        // original formatting, but also ensures that the actual -h or --help
4591        // specified by the user is sent through. If hide_short_help is not included,
4592        // then items specified with hidden_short_help will also be hidden.
4593        let should_long = |v: &Arg| {
4594            v.get_long_help().is_some()
4595                || v.is_hide_long_help_set()
4596                || v.is_hide_short_help_set()
4597                || v.get_possible_values()
4598                    .iter()
4599                    .any(PossibleValue::should_show_help)
4600        };
4601
4602        // Subcommands aren't checked because we prefer short help for them, deferring to
4603        // `cmd subcmd --help` for more.
4604        self.get_long_about().is_some()
4605            || self.get_before_long_help().is_some()
4606            || self.get_after_long_help().is_some()
4607            || self.get_arguments().any(should_long)
4608    }
4609
4610    // Should we color the help?
4611    pub(crate) fn color_help(&self) -> ColorChoice {
4612        #[cfg(feature = "color")]
4613        if self.is_disable_colored_help_set() {
4614            return ColorChoice::Never;
4615        }
4616
4617        self.get_color()
4618    }
4619}
4620
4621impl Default for Command {
4622    fn default() -> Self {
4623        Self {
4624            name: Default::default(),
4625            long_flag: Default::default(),
4626            short_flag: Default::default(),
4627            display_name: Default::default(),
4628            bin_name: Default::default(),
4629            author: Default::default(),
4630            version: Default::default(),
4631            long_version: Default::default(),
4632            about: Default::default(),
4633            long_about: Default::default(),
4634            before_help: Default::default(),
4635            before_long_help: Default::default(),
4636            after_help: Default::default(),
4637            after_long_help: Default::default(),
4638            aliases: Default::default(),
4639            short_flag_aliases: Default::default(),
4640            long_flag_aliases: Default::default(),
4641            usage_str: Default::default(),
4642            usage_name: Default::default(),
4643            help_str: Default::default(),
4644            disp_ord: Default::default(),
4645            term_w: Default::default(),
4646            max_w: Default::default(),
4647            #[cfg(feature = "help")]
4648            template: Default::default(),
4649            settings: Default::default(),
4650            g_settings: Default::default(),
4651            args: Default::default(),
4652            subcommands: Default::default(),
4653            replacers: Default::default(),
4654            groups: Default::default(),
4655            current_help_heading: Default::default(),
4656            current_disp_ord: Some(0),
4657            subcommand_value_name: Default::default(),
4658            subcommand_heading: Default::default(),
4659            external_value_parser: Default::default(),
4660            long_help_exists: false,
4661        }
4662    }
4663}
4664
4665impl Index<&'_ Id> for Command {
4666    type Output = Arg;
4667
4668    fn index(&self, key: &Id) -> &Self::Output {
4669        self.find(key).expect(INTERNAL_ERROR_MSG)
4670    }
4671}
4672
4673impl From<&'_ Command> for Command {
4674    fn from(cmd: &'_ Command) -> Self {
4675        cmd.clone()
4676    }
4677}
4678
4679impl fmt::Display for Command {
4680    fn fmt(&self, f: &mut fmt::Formatter) -> fmt::Result {
4681        write!(f, "{}", self.name)
4682    }
4683}
4684
4685fn two_elements_of<I, T>(mut iter: I) -> Option<(T, T)>
4686where
4687    I: Iterator<Item = T>,
4688{
4689    let first = iter.next();
4690    let second = iter.next();
4691
4692    match (first, second) {
4693        (Some(first), Some(second)) => Some((first, second)),
4694        _ => None,
4695    }
4696}

4698#[test]
4699fn check_auto_traits() {
4700    static_assertions::assert_impl_all!(Command: Send, Sync, Unpin);
4701}
